html:
131 U.S. 396

9 S.Ct. 794

33 L.Ed. 222

LIST
v.
STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA.1

December 10, 1888.

W. P. Potter, for plaintiff in error.

W. D. Porter, for the State of Pennsylvania.

PER CURIAM.

1

The death of George B. List, the plaintiff in error in this cause, having been suggested in a communication from the counsel for defendant in error to the clerk, and it appearing to the court that this is a criminal case, it is considered by the court that this cause has abated. Therefore it is ordered and adjudged by the court that the writ of error in this cause be, and the same is hereby, dismissed.

1

Publication delayed through failure to receive copy.

PENNSYLVANIA.

No. 984.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided December 10, 1888.
ERROR TO THE SUPREME COURT OF THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA.

Mr. W.P. Potter for plaintiff in error.

Mr. W.D. Porter for defendant in error.

PER CURIAM:

The death of George B. List, the plaintiff in error in this cause, having been suggested in a communication from counsel for defendant in error to the clerk, and it appearing to the court that this is a criminal case, it is considered by the court that this cause has abated. Therefore, it is ordered and adjudged by the court that the writ of error in this cause be, and the same is hereby,

Dismissed.
